content.text:
A 32-year-old woman has the acute onset of fever, cough, and dyspnea as she is preparing to leave her work and go home. When she gets home the symptoms have abated. This scenario is repeated on multiple occasions over the next 6 weeks. On physical examination she has no abnormal findings. A transbronchial biopsy is performed after she is hospitalized with respiratory distress. The microscopic appearance of the biopsy is shown here. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? <image 1> 

A. Influenza viral pneumonia
B. Hypersensitivity pneumonitis
C. Diffuse alveolar damage
D. Miliary tuberculosis

The image provided shows a histological section of lung tissue with characteristic features of granulomatous inflammation, including the presence of multinucleated giant cells and lymphocytes. These findings are consistent with hypersensitivity pneumonitis (also known as extrinsic allergic alveolitis).

Given the clinical scenario described—acute onset of fever, cough, and dyspnea that resolves when the patient leaves work and recurs over multiple occasions—it suggests an environmental exposure at work that triggers an immune response in the lungs.

Therefore, the most likely diagnosis is:

B. Hypersensitivity pneumonitis
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
